conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through A, B, and C, we need to analyze the flow paths created by the colored baffles.
The liquids from A, B, and C are indicated by arrows, and the baffles are positioned to guide the flow.
The yellow liquid from A flows downwards, encounters the blue baffle, is redirected towards the black baffle, and continues towards container D.
The blue liquid from B flows downwards, encounters the teal baffle, is redirected towards the black baffle, and continues towards container D.
The green liquid from C flows downwards, encounters the black baffle, and continues towards container D.
All liquids (yellow, blue, and green) are directed towards container D by the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through A, B, and C.
